channel.title: GUI background help
channel.description: i still can't figure out how to make the background color of my GUI say black for example without getting a error and it won't work. can someone help please?

item.title: GUI background help
item.dc:creator: @Rictoo Rictoo
item.description:
@Rictoo wrote:

Rune Hacker:

how would you set an image from the internet as the background for a JFrame?

BufferedImage bi = ImageIO.read(new File("background.jpg")); JFrame jf = new JFrame(); jf.setSize(500, 500); jf.setVisible(true); jf.getContentPane().add(bi);

I think that would work >>

Read full topic

item.title: GUI background help
item.dc:creator: @nueb35 Nueb35
item.description:
@nueb35 wrote:

[quote=“the angel of death, post:6, topic:137317”][quote author=nueb35 link=topic=188869.msg1705158#msg1705158 date=1188177888]
try this sence an applet is basicly a frame… add the applet to the frame and then add all the other things to the applet and wen your setting the applet do it like this :

JApplet Applet = new JApplet() {public void paint(Graphics G){G.setBackground(Color.BLUE);}};

just wrote that on the quick reply box dunno if thats the right way >.>
[/quote]
wtf is that lol i don’t have a applet atm i use jframe lol not applet.[/quote]

im guessing that wa sthe format of the quote that u wanted to put in and i never sayd u didnt have a JFrame i sayd add the JApplet to the JFrame and add all other things JButton ect. to the JApplet >.>

Read full topic
